disasterInfo.title: Disaster Information
disasterInfo.subtitle: Learn about different types of disasters and safety measures

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Find answers to common questions about the Jalsaathi Dashboard disaster reporting platform

questions.whatIsJalsaathiAnswer: Jalsaathi Dashboard is a comprehensive disaster reporting platform that allows citizens to report disasters, view real-time reports, and provides analytics for emergency response teams. It's built with modern technologies including React, TypeScript, Node.js, Express, and MongoDB Atlas to ensure reliability and scalability.
questions.disasterTypes: What types of disasters can I report?
questions.disasterTypesAnswer: You can report the following types of disasters:
questions.severityLevels: What are the severity levels for disaster reports?
questions.severityLevelsAnswer: Disaster reports are categorized into four severity levels:
questions.createAccount: How do I create an account?
questions.createAccountAnswer: Creating an account is simple and free:
questions.submitReport: How do I submit a disaster report?
questions.mediaFiles: What media files can I upload with my report?
questions.mediaFilesAnswer: You can upload the following types of media files:
questions.verificationProcess: How does the report verification process work?
questions.verificationProcessAnswer: All reports go through a verification process:
questions.contactSupportAnswer: If you need help or have questions, you can contact us through:
questions.mobileDevices: Is the platform available on mobile devices?
questions.mobileDevicesAnswer: Yes! The platform is fully responsive and works on all devices including smartphones, tablets, and desktop computers. The interface automatically adapts to different screen sizes for optimal viewing and interaction. We recommend using a modern web browser for the best experience.
questions.supportedBrowsersAnswer: The platform supports all modern web browsers including Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge, and Opera. We recommend using the latest version of your preferred browser for the best performance and security. JavaScript must be enabled for the platform to function properly.
questions.canComment: Can I comment on disaster reports?
questions.canCommentAnswer: Yes! You can comment on any disaster report to provide additional information, ask questions, or share updates. Comments help build a community around disaster awareness and response. You can also edit or delete your own comments if needed.
questions.howToVote: How do I vote on reports?
questions.howToVoteAnswer: You can vote on disaster reports to help indicate their accuracy and importance. Click the thumbs up or thumbs down buttons on any report. Your vote helps the community and administrators understand which reports are most reliable and urgent.
questions.interactiveMap: What is the interactive map feature?
questions.interactiveMapAnswer: The interactive map shows all verified disaster reports with color-coded markers based on severity levels. You can click on markers to view detailed information about each report, zoom in/out, and navigate to different areas. The map helps visualize disaster patterns and locations across your region.
questions.whatAnalyticsAnswer: The platform provides comprehensive analytics including:
questions.adminFeaturesAnswer: Administrators have access to advanced features:
questions.realTimeNotificationsAnswer: The platform uses WebSocket technology to provide real-time updates. You'll receive instant notifications for new disaster reports in your area, status changes to your reports, admin responses, and other important updates. Notifications appear in the notification dropdown in the top navigation bar.
questions.dataSecurityAnswer: Yes, we take security seriously and implement multiple security measures:
questions.editDeleteReports: Can I edit or delete my reports?
questions.editDeleteReportsAnswer: Yes, you can edit or delete your own reports as long as they haven't been verified by an administrator. Once a report is verified, it becomes part of the public record and cannot be modified to maintain data integrity. You can always add comments to provide updates or additional information.

steps.step1: Click the "Login" button in the top navigation
steps.step2: Select the "Register" tab in the login modal
steps.step5: You'll be automatically logged in after successful registration
steps.reportStep1: Make sure you're logged in to your account
steps.reportStep2: Click the "Report Disaster" button in the top navigation
steps.reportStep3: Fill out the report form with:
steps.reportStep4: Click "Submit Report" to send your report
steps.reportStep5: Your report will be reviewed by administrators

disasterInfo.title: Disaster Information
disasterInfo.subtitle: Emergency guidelines, safety tips, and preparedness information

tsunami.name: Tsunami
tsunami.description: Large ocean waves caused by underwater earthquakes or landslides
safetyTipsList: Move to higher ground immediately
Stay away from beaches and coastal areas
Listen to emergency broadcasts
Do not return until all-clear is given

cyclone.name: Cyclone
cyclone.description: Rotating storm system with strong winds and heavy rainfall
safetyTipsList: Stay indoors and away from windows
Secure loose outdoor objects
Stock up on emergency supplies
Follow evacuation orders if issued

flood.name: Coastal Flooding
flood.description: Water overflow from ocean or rivers into normally dry areas
safetyTipsList: Move to higher ground
Avoid walking or driving through flood water
Stay informed via radio or mobile alerts
Turn off utilities if instructed

oilSpill.name: Oil Spill
oilSpill.description: Release of petroleum products into ocean or coastal environment
safetyTipsList: Avoid contact with oil or contaminated water
Report spills to authorities immediately
Keep pets and children away from affected areas
Use protective equipment if helping cleanup

emergencyKit.title: Emergency Kit Checklist
emergencyKit.subtitle: Prepare these essential items for emergency situations

waterFood: 1 gallon water per person per day

emergencyKit.reminderText: Check and update your emergency kit every 6 months. Replace expired items and update documents.

evacuation.searchPlaceholder: Search evacuation centers by name or location...
tips: Know multiple routes to evacuation centers
Keep your emergency kit ready to go
Register with center staff upon arrival

emergencyContacts.singleEmergencyNumber: Single emergency number for all services
emergencyContacts.saveNumbers: Save these numbers in your phone for quick access during emergencies

reportModal.title: Report Disaster
reportModal.subtitle: Submit a detailed report about a disaster or emergency situation. All fields marked with * are required.

floodSafety.title: Flood Safety Guidelines
floodSafety.content: Move to higher ground immediately. Avoid walking or driving through flood waters.
floodSafety.description: Flooding is one of the most common natural disasters and can occur with little warning. Being prepared and knowing what to do can save your life.
keySteps: Move to higher ground immediately - do not wait for instructions
Avoid walking or driving through flood waters - just 6 inches of moving water can knock you down
Stay away from bridges over fast-moving water
Turn around, don't drown - find an alternative route
If trapped in a building, go to the highest floor but avoid closed attics
warningSigns: Rising water levels in nearby streams or rivers
Storm surge alerts for coastal areas

emergencyContacts.title: Emergency Contacts
emergencyContacts.content: National Emergency: 112 | Coast Guard: 1554 | Local Authority: 100
emergencyContacts.description: Keep these emergency numbers handy and program them into your phone for quick access during disasters.
tips: Save all numbers in your phone contacts
Keep a physical list in case phone battery dies
Test numbers periodically to ensure they work

emergencyKit.title: Emergency Kit Checklist
emergencyKit.content: Water, food, flashlight, radio, batteries, first aid kit, medications.
emergencyKit.description: A well-stocked emergency kit can be a lifesaver during disasters. Keep it in an easily accessible location and check it regularly.

items: 1 gallon water per person per day (3-day supply)

additionalTips: Store items in airtight plastic bags
Consider special needs for elderly or disabled family members
Keep a smaller kit in your car

evacuationRoutes.title: Evacuation Routes
evacuationRoutes.content: Know your nearest evacuation center and multiple routes to reach it.
evacuationRoutes.description: Planning evacuation routes in advance is crucial for your safety. Know multiple ways to reach safety from your home, workplace, and other frequented locations.
planningSteps: Identify evacuation centers in your area
Plan multiple routes to each center
Consider different types of disasters (flood, fire, earthquake)
Practice evacuation routes with family members
Keep maps in your emergency kit
importantNotes: Take your emergency kit with you
Lock your home but don't delay evacuation
